body:
I am also seeing the same error. Thanks for creating the issue!

I have found that this problem occurs in a bit of a special case, when there is more than one animal that has no markings at all.
This can be caused by one animal being in a remote location and being eliminated by cropping, which is part of the multi-animal tracking flow.

If there is no marking, the `get_batch` function (L168-170) in `pose_estimation_tensorflow\dataset\pose_multianimal_imgaug.py` create `joint_points` as an array shorter than the Max_number of the animal in the videos.

```
joint_points = np.concatenate(
    [Joints[person_id][:, 1:3] for person_id in Joints.keys()]
    )
```
I think this caused out-of-array references when doing `compute_target_part_scoremap_numpy` function (L393).

```
joint_ids = joint_id[person_id].copy()
```

Maybe I'm totally missing the point, in which case, please ignore it! I hope this is helpful.
That's correct @bobfromjapan! I'm really sorry I let this pass, but I'll push a fix and stricter tests soon ðŸ˜•

Wow! How amazing that the issue is so efficiently handled!
Thank you @bobfromjapan and @jeylau !

issue.title: Fix IndexError when training with identity

repository.name: DeepLabCut
repository.description: Official implementation of DeepLabCut: Markerless pose estimation of user-defined features with deep learning for all animals incl. humans

license.name: GNU Lesser General Public License v3.0

issue.body:
My previous fix did not last long, as I overlooked the fact that, due to cropping, not all animals are present in an image.
This is now implemented correctly, and comes with unit tests for all core MAPoseDataset methods (those called while batching and preloading the data notably).

Fixes #1290

body: Sorry about it @mynschen @bobfromjapan, but this should finally be fixed with #1297. If you guys want to try it, please let me know if training runs properly ðŸ˜…

Hi @jeylau !

I have used `identity_tests` branch today, and it worked completely with my dataset! I was able to perform standard training and video analysis with no problem using multi-animal & Identity=True.
Thank you for your great work!!

But, actually, I encountered another IndexError with `assemble with identity only` option in analysis videos. 
I don't know enough about the cause of the problem yet, so I might raise an Issue after some investigation(it might be a problem with my data set!).

Best Regard,
@bobfromjapan thanks so much for the sponsor ðŸ’–

Thank you @jeylau and @bobfromjapan !
The training with identity works smoothly now!

Just that:
If Calibrate animal assembly=Yes (No matter if Assembly with identity only=Yes/No)
then an numpy.linalig.LinAlgError occurs in convert2_tracklets in analyze_videos.py
Would be wonderful to figure out why!

Despite the remaining bug, I really want to express my respect! The identity switch in Identity=False were all gone now! Magic!

The screenshot of the numpy.linalig.LinAlgError mentioned above:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/53803897/120649984-ed085800-c4af-11eb-9526-4d31224866d9.png)

Looks like your labeled data may be too sparse to robustly determine the prior "skeleton distribution". Keep it turned off then, and I'll make sure to catch this error so it is more informative to the user. ðŸ˜…
